skill.name: writing-plans
skill.description: Use when you have a spec or requirements for a multi-step task, before touching code
skill.summary: Use when you have a spec or requirements for a multi-step task, before touching code
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown templates. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. Static findings are false positives triggered by markdown syntax and common English words misidentified as security patterns.

content.value_statement: Writing comprehensive implementation plans prevents context switching and ensures no steps are missed during complex software development. This skill breaks down multi-step tasks into bite-sized, test-driven steps with exact file paths and commands.
actual_capabilities: Generates comprehensive implementation plans from specs or requirements
Breaks complex tasks into bite-sized 2-5 minute steps
Creates test-driven development workflows with failing tests first
Documents exact file paths, code snippets, and shell commands
Follows DRY, YAGNI, and frequent commit best practices
Saves plans to docs/plans directory with standardized structure
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Requires a dedicated worktree created by brainstorming skill
Cannot access external documentation or APIs without explicit context
Plan execution requires separate skill for actual implementation

use_cases.title: Plan feature implementation
use_cases.description: Break down new feature specs into actionable TDD steps with exact file paths and test commands

use_cases.title: Create team implementation guides
use_cases.description: Generate detailed plans for complex refactoring or architectural changes with clear handoff points

use_cases.title: Structure development workflows
use_cases.description: Transform requirements into step-by-step plans executable by subagents or parallel sessions

prompt_templates.title: New feature planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the writing-plans skill to create an implementation plan for [describe your feature]. Save it to docs/plans/

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-plans to plan fixing [describe the bug]. Include test cases that reproduce the issue first

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-plans to plan the refactoring of [describe component]. Include test coverage and migration steps

prompt_templates.title: Integration planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-plans to plan the integration of [describe third-party service]. Include API setup and error handling

best_practices: Provide complete context and requirements for accurate task breakdown
Use dedicated worktrees for planned work to isolate changes
Follow generated test commands to verify each step before moving on
anti_patterns: Using without a dedicated worktree can lead to context mixing
Skipping the initial context phase reduces plan quality
Not saving plans to docs/plans loses tracking and handoff capability

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Writing Plans works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Designed for Claude Code workflows but adapts to standard usage.

faq.question: What makes a good input for planning?
faq.answer: Clear requirements, user stories, or technical specifications work best. Include relevant constraints or dependencies.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use with brainstorming skill first to create worktree, then use executing-plans or subagent-driven-development for execution.

faq.question: Is my data safe when creating plans?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no network access. Plans are saved locally to your docs/plans directory.

faq.question: Why are the steps so granular?
faq.answer: Bite-sized 2-5 minute steps enable frequent commits, easier code review, and safer parallel execution by subagents.

faq.question: How is this different from just asking Claude directly?
faq.answer: This skill enforces standardized structure with TDD requirements, exact file paths, and specific commands for each step.
